> Looks mostly like swapping to me. JVMs can use a signficant amount
> of memory beyond the 'heap' space -- we've seen hundreds of 
megabytes
> more, especially with long-running and multi-threaded applications.
> 
> The 'nice' CPU figures below are also a little suspicious. If you
> didn't run your JVMs niced, then something else was moderately busy
> at that time, perhaps doing disk I/O.
> 

I forgot to mention that I started heritrix with nice so that the 
long running crawler won't impact other activities.

I have pretty much the same configuration I ran with 1.0.4 and the 
system does not have this problem. That leads me to think maybe it's 
something related to the 1.4 release.

-joe
